list-item.p: Amplifies a few copies of target DNA.
Higher sensitivity and specificity is attributed to continuous amplification under isothermal condition employing four primers recognizing six distinct regions of the target (Parida 2008).
Cost-effective as it can be carried out with simplest equipment, i.e., dry bath/water bath (Enomoto et al. 2005).
Vast application area in detection of different types of microorganisms (detection of variety of bacteria, viruses, parasites, and fungus) (Endo et al. 2004; Okafuji et al. 2005).
Can detect RNA genome of a pathogen by reverse transcription using reverse transcriptase enzyme (Soliman et al. 2009).
LAMP product can be easily detected visually either by using SYBR Green I or by using turbidometer.
Free online software Primer-Explorer IV software program ( http://primerexplorer.jp/e/) is available for LAMP primer design.
